tool.name: ProcessNavStreetsData

param.name: input_streets_feature_class
param.dialogReference: The line feature class of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the streets. This feature class is typically named "Streets".

param.name: input_altstreets_feature_class
param.dialogReference: The line feature class of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the alternate streets. This feature class is typically named "AltStreets".

param.name: input_zlevels_feature_class
param.dialogReference: The line feature class of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that indicates the Z-level values. This feature class is typically named "ZLevels".

param.name: input_cdms_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the condition/driving manoeuvres. This table is typically named "Cdms".

param.name: input_rdms_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the restricted driving manoeuvres. This table is typically named "Rdms".

param.name: input_signs_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that represents the highway signs. This table is typically named "Signs".

param.name: output_file_geodatabase
param.dialogReference: The full path including the name of the file geodatabase to be created containing the resulting network dataset.

param.name: output_file_geodatabase_version
param.dialogReference: The ArcGIS version of the file geodatabase to create.

param.name: feature_dataset_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the feature dataset to be created in the output file geodatabase.

param.name: network_dataset_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the network dataset to be created in the output file geodatabase.

param.name: input_create_network_attributes_in_metric
param.dialogReference:
Indicates if the output network dataset contains attributes in metric or non-metric units of measure.

  • Checked -- The distance network attribute will be in kilometers, and the Transport network attributes will be in meters and kilograms.

  • Unchecked -- The distance network attribute will be in miles, and the Transport network attributes will be in feet and pounds.

param.name: input_create_arcgis_online_network_attributes
param.dialogReference:
Indicates if the output network dataset is created with all of the network attributes used in the ArcGIS Online datasets. This is useful when you need to create a network dataset for use in the Network Analysis services in ArcGIS Online.

  • Checked -- A network dataset with all ArcGIS Online network attributes will be created. Note that this option takes additional time for processing as compared to the Unchecked option.

  • Unchecked -- A network dataset will be created. This option creates as few fields on the Streets feature class as possible.

param.name: input_time_zone_id_base_field_name
param.displayname: Input Time Zone ID Base Field Name
param.dialogReference:
The name of the field in your Streets feature class that contains the time zone IDs. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Time Zone Table parameter.

If time zones are modeled for each direction of travel, then only specify the base name of the field. For example, if the fields are named FT_TimeZoneID and TF_TimeZoneID, then specify TimeZoneID for this parameter.

param.name: input_time_zone_table
param.dialogReference: The time zone table created by the ProcessNavStreetsTimeZones tool. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Time Zone ID Base field Name parameter.

param.name: input_common_time_zone_for_the_entire_dataset
param.displayname: Input Time Zone for the Entire Dataset
param.dialogReference: The time zone that is valid for the entire extent of the input data. This name is the official name of the time zone as defined by Microsoft. This parameter is ignored Input Time Zone Table parameter is specified.

param.name: input_traffic_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data that contains the traffic codes. This table is typically named "Traffic". This parameter must be specified if you specify the Input TMC Reference File or Input Live Traffic Feed parameters.

param.name: input_link_reference_file_fc1_4
param.displayname: Input Link Reference File covering Functional Classes 1-4
param.dialogReference: The .csv file of your NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns data that contains the link references for the roads in Functional Classes 1 through 4. This file has a name that typically contains "REF", "LINK", and "FC1-4" in it. If this parameter is specified, you must also specify the Input Link Reference File covering Functional Class 5 and Input Speed Patterns Dictionary (SPD) File parameters.

param.name: input_link_reference_file_fc5
param.displayname: Input Link Reference File covering Functional Class 5
param.dialogReference: The .csv file of your NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns data that contains the link references for the roads in Functional Class 5. This file has a name that typically contains "REF", "LINK", and "FC5" in it. If this parameter is specified, you must also specify the Input Link Reference File covering Functional Classes 1-4 and Input Speed Patterns Dictionary (SPD) File parameters.

param.name: input_tmc_reference_file
param.dialogReference: The .csv file of your NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns data that contains the TMC references. This file has a name that typically contains "REF" and "TMC" in it. If this parameter is specified, you must also specify the Input Traffic Table and Input Speed Patterns Dictionary (SPD) File parameters. This parameter is ignored if the Input Link Reference File parameters are specified.

param.name: input_spd_file
param.dialogReference: The .csv file of your NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns data that contains the 15-minute granular Speed Patterns Dictionary (SPD) in kilometers per hour (KPH). This file has a name that typically contains "SPD" and "15MIN_KPH" in it. This parameter must be specified if you specify the Input Link Reference File parameters or the Input TMC Reference File parameter.

param.name: input_live_traffic_feed_folder
param.dialogReference: The folder of your live traffic feed files. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Traffic Table parameter.

param.name: input_live_traffic_feed_arcgis_server_connection
param.displayname: Input Live Traffic Feed ArcGIS Server Connection
param.dialogReference: The connection to your ArcGIS Server live traffic feed. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Traffic Table, Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Service Name, and Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Task Name parameters.

param.name: input_live_traffic_feed_geoprocessing_service_name
param.displayname: Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Service Name
param.dialogReference: The name of your live traffic feed geoprocessing service. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Traffic Table, Input Live Traffic Feed ArcGIS Server Connection, and Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Task Name parameters.

param.name: input_live_traffic_feed_geoprocessing_task_name
param.displayname: Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Task Name
param.dialogReference: The name of your live traffic feed geoprocessing task. This parameter must be specified together with the Input Traffic Table, Input Live Traffic Feed ArcGIS Server Connection, and Input Live Traffic Feed Geoprocessing Service Name parameters.

param.name: input_us_cndmod_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS Transport data that represents the condition modifiers within the United States. This table is typically named "CndMod".

param.name: input_non_us_cndmod_table
param.dialogReference: The table of your NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS Transport data that represents the condition modifiers outside the United States. This table is typically named "CndMod".

param.name: input_build_the_network_dataset
param.dialogReference:
Indicates if the output network dataset is built immediately after it is created. It is useful to uncheck this option when you need to make changes to the network dataset after it gets created and you'd like to postpone buiding the network dataset until after you've made these changes; otherwise leave this option checked on.

  • Checked -- The network dataset will be built immediately after it gets created. This is the default.

  • Unchecked -- The network dataset will be created but will not be built.

tool.summary: This tool reads in NAVTEQ™ NAVSTREETS™ data (including NAVTEQ Transport™ attributes if provided) and NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns™ data (if provided) and creates a file geodatabase with a network dataset that can be analyzed with ArcGIS Network Analyst. The tool first creates the feature classes and tables needed for the network dataset, then creates and builds the network dataset.
tool.usage:
• The tool requires Network Analyst extension license.

  • If you run the tool using an ArcInfo license, the tool spatially sorts the street features while converting them to feature classes in the file geodatabase. Spatially sorted street features result in faster route shape generation when perfoming network analysis.

  • Multiple regions of NAVTEQ NAVSTREETS data can be processed together to create a larger network dataset. First use the Merge tool to combine the similar layers of the NAVSTREETS data into common feature classes and tables, then pass these combined feature classes and tables as inputs to this tool. Be sure to keep the Condition Modifier (CndMod) records from the United States separate from the CndMod records from outside the United States, as the Transport attributes inside the United States use a different system of measurement.

  • The restricted driving manoeuvres as modeled in the NAVSTREETS data do not coincide with the network dataset turn model as described in the section Properly defined turns in the ArcGIS Desktop Help. As a result, build errors occur when the tool builds the network dataset. Those turn features that generate the errors are indicated by a value of 1 in the BuildError column of the turn feature class. You should edit the turn features at street intersections containing these errors so they comply with the network dataset model.

  • Notes on using this tool with NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns data:

    • This tool works with either the Link-Referenced or TMC-Referenced Relational Formats of NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns. If both formats are specified, the Link-Referenced format will be used.

    • The Link-Referenced format should only be used when creating a dataset covering the entire continent.

    • When using the TMC-Referenced Relational Format, the TMC Reference Table (REF) .csv file typically covers the entire continent. Only pass into this tool a .csv file that contains only the TMC references corresponding to the region that you intend to process.

    • This tool only makes use of the 15-minute granular Speed Patterns Dictionary (SPD) .csv file in KPH. Do not use the 60-minute granular and/or MPH files.

scriptExample.title: ProcessNavStreetsData Python Example
scriptExample.para: Create and build a network dataset from NAVSTREETS data
scriptExample.code:
# Name: ProcessNavStreetsData_nasample.py # Description: Create and build a network dataset from NAVSTREETS data. # Requirements: Network Analyst Extension # Author: ESRI
#Import system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
#Check out the Network Analyst extension license arcpy.CheckOutExtension("Network")
#Import the toolbox containing the tool arcpy.ImportToolbox("C:/MyTools/Vendor Data Processing Tools.tbx")
#Set environment settings env.workspace = "C:/data/NAVSTREETS"
#Set local variables inStreets = "Streets.shp" inAltStreets = "AltStreets.shp" inZLevels = "Zlevels.shp" inCDMS = "Cdms.dbf" inRDMS = "Rdms.dbf" inSigns = "Signs.dbf" outFileGDB = "Hawaii.gdb" fdName = "Routing" ndName = "Routing_ND" inMetric = "False" arcgisOnlineAttributes = "False" inCommonTimeZone = "Hawaiian Standard Time" inTraffic = "Traffic.dbf" inTMC = "NTP_REF_Hawaii_TMC_09400.csv" inSPD = "NTP_SPD_NA_15MIN_KPH_09400.csv" inCndMod = "CndMod.dbf" inBuild = "True"
#Create and build the network dataset arcpy.ProcessNavStreetsData_nasample(inStreets, inAltStreets, inZLevels, inCDMS, inRDMS, inSigns, outFileGDB, "10.1", fdName, ndName, inMetric, arcgisOnlineAttributes, "#", "#", inCommonTimeZone, inTraffic, "#", "#" inTMC, inSPD, "#", "#", "#", "#", inCndMod, "#", inBuild)
print "Script completed successfully."

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool reads in NAVTEQ™ NAVSTREETS™ data (including NAVTEQ Transport™ attributes if provided) and NAVTEQ Traffic Patterns™ data (if provided) and creates a file geodatabase with a network dataset that can be analyzed with ArcGIS Network Analyst. The tool first creates the feature classes and tables needed for the network dataset, then creates and builds the network dataset.
